right click ur run and click edit, add that in there

item.title: I really need help right now; out of time; running a file with command
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

I can only be on for a few more minutes so please answer me this…
What’s wrong with this method

public void runserver() { try { String File = "voule.bat"; // File specified String Dir = "C:/Documents and Settings/USER/Desktop/DefaultScape/"+File; // Directory specified Runtime.getRuntime().exec(Dir); } catch (IOException ioe) { ioe.printStackTrace(); } }

Why won’t it run?!

NOTE: I’M TRYING TO USE A COMMAND LIKE ::RESET TO RUN THE SERVER.

WHEN I RUN IT, I DO THE COMMAND, AND I GET KICKED, BUT VOULE.BAT DOESN’T RUN!

Read full topic
